alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MARION COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ocklawaha to 7 miles southwest of Santos to 6 miles northeast of Inverness. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weirsdale, The Village of Briar Meadow, Ocklawaha, Moss Bluff, Lake Weir, Belleview, and Summerfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
